programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: In the savannah, Dr. Bonnie must perform a critical surgery on zebra Zaide's badly damaged tail. Tiger Indrah gets an incredible tenth birthday surprise, and Dr. Sarah is determined to solve spider monkey Isobella's medical mystery.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Parker investigates a rotting bear carcass that was dumped on the side of the road, leading him on a hunt across Maine to find a potential poacher. Blanchard catches a couple behaving badly on a wildlife refuge. Robertson rescues some ducklings.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: A speeding dirt biker eludes Warden Robertson, but leaves a crucial clue to his whereabouts. Two dogs on the loose are chasing newborn deer. An ATV accident victim has an odd explanation for what caused his crash.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: The discovery of a dead beaver in a Skowhegan parking lot leads Warden Parker on an exhaustive investigation involving surveillance cameras, anonymous informants and the assistance of the local police.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Canfield breaks up a 45-year-old illegal fishing tournament. Officer MacFadzen rescues an injured hawk. Officer Hannett confronts two kids riding OHRVs on the road. On Mt. Chocorua, officers rescue a woman with a fractured ankle.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Pre-dawn on opening day of rifle season, Lt. Boudreau and Officer Hannett pursue a night hunter. While up north, Officers Canfield and St. Pierre battle the snow to work a deer decoy. And in the city, Officer Frye wrestles an aggressive wild turkey.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Hannett patrols for ice fishermen while Lt. Boudreau investigates a hunter who shot towards a road. Officer Holmes deals with a raccoon hiding in a warm chimney. And later, Officer St. Pierre goes on his first dive recovery under the ice.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officer Cyrs gets a call about a rabid fox that attacked a homeowner. Officer Crouse tracks down a group of ATV riders. Lt. Murphy talks to a farmer about a nuisance bear. Officers Frye and Jones investigate a hunter that may have shot from the road.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Lt. Boudreau and Officer Hannett have an unusually busy day on ATV patrol. Officer McDermott investigates a man who illegally shot a rabbit in a residential area. Officers Holmes and Cyrs use ATVs to rescue an injured hiker on Mount Carter.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: The wardens, the National Guard, and dozens of volunteers team up in a massive, days-long search for a hiker missing in the vast wilderness of the White Mountains. And, the wardens take on some familiar faces in a charity softball game.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Officers Bronson and Towne get more than they bargained for with a speeding snowmobiler. The K-9 unit performs winter training. Officer MacFadzen patrols an ice drag racing event. Then, Officer Cyrs heads into the woods to investigate a hit and run.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Conservation Officers statewide join forces with volunteers and the National Guard to launch an intensive search for a missing hiker. In Littleton, Officer McKee gets news of a bear who has infiltrated a home in search of food.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: During a busy winter weekend, Lt. Boudreau encounters kite skiers, an illegal fire sled and a vandalized bob-house. Officer Canfield searches for a deer with an arrow in its head. Then, Officers Demler and Towne head our on a mountain rescue.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Sgt. Lopashanski attempts every trick in the book to wrangle a stubborn moose off of a busy roadway. Officer Canfield plays a game of cat and mouse with a suspected illegal deer hunter, and Officer McKee and Demler investigate an illegal turkey kill.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: The officers revisit their most memorable rescues. Sgt. Lucas reflects on an intense rescue mission on Mt. Madison. MacFadzen recounts the rescue of a barred owl trapped in a fence. And Bronson recalls a multi-day search for a missing hiker.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: A team of officers stakeout hunting sites across New Hampshire after reports of illegal activity. Officer Lopashanski investigates the mysterious discovery of untagged, unregistered deer parts hanging in front of a burnt-out building.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Texas game wardens protect the natural resources of their vast state while fighting crime.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: On Mt. Monadnock, a severed finger is found, sending a team and K-9 Wyatt to search for other possible body parts. A family of repeat offenders are found riding their ATVs without proper protective gear, and a man admits to an illegal bear kill.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Pre-dawn on opening day of rifle season, Lt. Boudreau and Officer Hannett pursue a night hunter. While up north, Officers Canfield and St. Pierre battle the snow to work a deer decoy. And in the city, Officer Frye wrestles an aggressive wild turkey.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: A team of officers stakeout hunting sites across New Hampshire after reports of illegal activity. Officer Lopashanski investigates the mysterious discovery of untagged, unregistered deer parts hanging in front of a burnt-out building.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: The officers revisit their most memorable rescues. Sgt. Lucas reflects on an intense rescue mission on Mt. Madison. MacFadzen recounts the rescue of a barred owl trapped in a fence. And Bronson recalls a multi-day search for a missing hiker.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: It's deer season, the most popular big game hunting season in the state.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: The wardens race against the clock to evacuate an injured hiker on the Appalachian Trail. A fishing license check leads Warden Dan Christianson to a suspicious stash. Things run afoul as Warden Kris MacCabe discovers great blue herons acting strangely.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Summer has arrived and people are filling up the woods and causing trouble. MacCabe finds a campsite where the occupants seem to have vanished, and the wardens search for a pot grow op after a drug deal went wrong.

programme.title: North Woods Law
programme.desc: Parker investigates a rotting bear carcass that was dumped on the side of the road, leading him on a hunt across Maine to find a potential poacher. Blanchard catches a couple behaving badly on a wildlife refuge. Robertson rescues some ducklings.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete treks to New York's Catskill Mountains to build an NTS first - a glasshouse in the sky. Piecing materials together like a puzzle, Pete uses his clients' collection of 50 vintage windows to construct an elegant treehouse encased by walls of glass.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete designs a ski chalet treehouse that glistens as bright as the freshest powder atop a black diamond run. The 20-ft high winter retreat comes complete with a secret bedroom and a double-sided fireplace to keep guests warm both inside and out.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete and his merry men trek to the Blue Ridge Mountains to build a treehouse for one of their own, carpenter Mike Reynolds. Sitting 16 feet high, it will be the perfect rustic guesthouse to host the raucous Appalachian Breaking Up Christmas tradition.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete builds a citadel fortress for a Texan couple who loves all things medieval. A 25 ft-high tower will hold a round table and thrones, as well as a glass floor loft. A metalsmith joins the build to craft medieval touches, like a dragon door handle.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete heads to Alabama's Appalachia to build a super spy treehouse. There, he pulls out all the stops to make the client's espionage-themed dreams come true. We're talking gadgets, hidden passageways, secret rooms and more.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete makes a treehouse touchdown in Pittsburgh for Antonio Brown, wide receiver for the Steelers. The game plan is to build a luxury skybox with a two-storey window wall that overlooks a custom basketball court and football field.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete creates an arboreal abode for an adventurous Alaskan couple that offers all the warm fuzzies they get from the outdoors without having to brave the bitter mountain cold.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete's fun-loving friend, and forklift supplier, is the lucky recipient of a treehouse built strictly for good times. The team builds a dream of a treehouse complete with a wine bar, a loft and their first ever hot tub in the woods of Western Washington.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Marty's dam is put to the test as the Raneys move an entire cabin into the flood zone. A surprise arrival of chicks has Misty needing an upgrade for her chicken coop. Matt crafts a knife blade in the Smiths' newly improved foundry.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: In order to rescue a homestead at risk of igniting the next big wildfire, the Raneys must overhaul Kevin Tubbs' faulty electrical system and build the first hydro-electric wheel on the Little Susitna River to make the homestead safe for his children.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: To save a single mom and her daughter from rampaging moose and secure a source of food, Marty builds a bridge across a murky creek to access more property, Matt teaches predator deterrent techniques, and Misty builds a snow-proof greenhouse.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: In Northern California, the Raneys give a masterclass on rebuilding from scratch when they come to the aid of the Olson-Wilcox family whose homestead was completely destroyed in a devastating wildfire.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: In a first-ever Homestead intervention, a daughter pleads for help from the Raneys to rescue her mother and step-father whose failing homestead in Arizona sits in the crosshairs of deadly monsoon floods and a menacing cougar.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys answer an SOS from a family displaced by their failing homestead. Marty must move a cabin onto a flood-proof foundation. Matt teaches an ill mother how to face her fear of invasive hogs, and Misty crafts a rice patty garden in a flood zone.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue: Survival Shelter
programme.desc: The Raneys band together to save a family's crumbling log cabin after a devastating earthquake. In Ohio, a family is struggling to survive in their pest-infested, tire bale homestead and are in desperate need of Marty, Matt and Misty's help.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue: Survival Shelter
programme.desc: The Raneys continue to salvage a family's tire bale home and work around-the-clock to provide fresh water and jumpstart an indoor garden. In Oregon, the Raneys build a family a viable water source by fabricating a solar still to de-contaminate the water.

programme.desc: Three brides hope Kleinfeld can top the dream dresses they've already found. Lucille found a satin dress, but still wants more bling. Dana is head-over-heels for a tulle gown her mom hates. Joan loves a dress back home but wants one unique to Kleinfeld.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Samantha has mastered her weight-loss goals, but can she get her mom to like her wedding dress? Shock jock Ashlee wants a ball gown that will make her mother blush. Plus, a bride has a glam wedding in Puerto Rico.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride Emiliegh and her brothers are super close and a family rivalry could jeopardize her bridal appointment. Bride Holly is awful at making decisions, and her wedding dress is no exception. Her big sister and young daughter have some suggestions.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Past Bachelorette Britt has found love and needs a dress ASAP. Designer Matthew Christopher has a suggestion or two in mind. Six-foot-two Bride Shelby hasn't found a dress she loves. The team prove hopes to find her the dress of her dreams.

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: Georgia's April and Chasity are best friends and couponing partners who are saving up for new stockpile storage buildings.

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: April shops to feed 200 parishioners and her family for a month for under $100. Carla shops to feed 20 guests at her lake house.

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: Julie has the chance to land her dream job: being paid to coupon for a sober home for teenage boys.

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: Desirae is so thrifty, she doesn't pay for newspapers and gets her coupons from public recycling bins. Stephanie teaches her son to coupon before sending him off to college.

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: Amanda tries to teach her parents to coupon so she can take some time off from shopping. Jess is a shopaholic and coupon addict.

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: Zadia takes her friends couponing to prove that she can still get super savings. Briana and her boyfriend, Jose, want to get engaged, but Briana won't let him go into debt to pay for the ring.

programme.title: Extreme Christmas Trees
